p.span: Bus meal deliveries will start again on Monday, April 20. Due to the National Weather Service’s prediction of severe weather during the Monday morning hours, our meal delivery will operate on a two-hour delay. Most buses will begin their routes at 10 a.m.
The deadlines for Pre-K/Kindergarten registration and hardship student transfer requests have been extended to May 7, 2020 due to our extended school closure in response to the spread of COVID-19.
Parents wishing to register for Pre-K/Kindergarten or apply for a hardship student transfer can complete the forms linked below and email them to lhyman@colleton.k12.sc.us.

strong.span: Distrito Escolar del Condado de Colleton
20-21 Spanish Early Childhood CERDEP Registration Packet

p.span: Colleton County School District will be observing our Spring Break Holiday on April 13 through April 19, giving our families, school nutrition staff, bus drivers, teachers and district officials that have worked hard during our school closure a needed rest.

During the week of April 13-19, CCSD will not be making bus meal deliveries, but Colleton County government officials will be operating meal pick-up locations for our students during the Spring Break period. You can find a list of meal pick-up locations and times here.
For additional information, call (843) 908-1897 or contact Eartha Cunningham at ecunningham@colletoncounty.org.
Normal bus meal deliveries will resume when we return from Spring Break on April 20.
Our W-Fi capable buses will be available for use until Friday, April 10. After that date, the buses will be decommissioned due to low usage rates. These buses are located at:
Bells Elementary School (12088 Bells Highway, Ruffin SC)
Black Street Early Childhood Center (256 Smith Street, Walterboro SC)
Colleton County Middle School (1379 Tuskegee Airman Drive, Walterboro SC)
Cottageville Elementary School (648 Peirce Road, Cottageville SC)
Forest Hills Elementary School (633 Hiers Corner Road, Walterboro, SC)
Hendersonville Elementary School (6089 Hendersonville Highway, Walterboro SC)
In addition, the district has set deadlines for the delivery of completed distance learning packets to our schools, based on guidance from the South Carolina Department of Education. Those dates are:
Packet 1 (distributed on March 16) – Deadline April 9, 2020
Packet 2 (distributed on April 1 and April 2) – Deadline May 8, 2020
Final Date to Turn in All Packets – Deadline May 15, 2020
All schools will have bins/tubs available in a covered location for parents to drop off distance learning packets, in compliance with Centers for Disease Control guidelines.

Colleton County High School students who will not be using an electronic device to complete distance learning assignments can pick up paper and pencil packets from CCHS Monday, April 6 from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.
In order to receive their correct packets, students/parents will need to know their class and teacher names.
Those who were unable to receive a Chromebook/Laptop during their initial distribution on April 1 or April 2 will be able to pick one up from CCHS April 6 from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.

Due to the closure of school by Governor Henry McMaster, changes in the grading periods have been made. The South Carolina Department of Education announced that the Third and Fourth Quarters will be combined as one semester, with a start date of January 6, 2020 and an interim date of March 13, 2020.

Starting April 1 parents will be able to log into the Parent Portal through PowerSchool to access their child's grades. Parents who do not have the Parent Portal set up can email Claudia Boensch at cboensch@colleton.k12.sc.us for support.

Due to Governor Henry McMaster’s March 24 order to extend the closure of all public schools in South Carolina through April 30, Colleton County School District will be providing additional distance learning opportunities to our students. Information on distance learning for K-8 students and Colleton County High School students is provided below.
K-8 Students

In order for students to receive new distance learning materials and drop off their completed packets, our K-8 schools will be open on Wednesday, April 1 from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. and Thursday, April 2 from 4 p.m. to 6 p.m. Parents who are not able to pick up these packets in person may also access them electronically on their child’s school website beginning April 2 after 3 p.m.
Colleton County High School Students

Colleton County High School students will be able to receive new distance learning materials and drop off their completed packets at their school on April 1 and April 2. Students who need Chromebooks/laptops to participate in online learning will have the opportunity to receive one when they drop off their completed packets. In order to receive these Chromebooks/laptops, students or their parents must present a form of state identification, sign a user agreement, and pay a $25 device maintenance/cleaning charge, which will be charged to the student’s PowerSchool account. No fees will be collected on the day of device pick up, but they will be assessed at a later date.
Pick-Up times for Chromebooks/laptops and paper and pencil learning packets are:

span.strong: April 1 – 9 a.m. to 11 a.m. for seniors, 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. for all grades.
April 2 – 4 p.m. to 6 p.m. for all grades.

p.span: Parents who are not able to attend the drop off/pick up sessions at their schools on April 1 and April 2 should contact their school’s principal for further instructions.
Any additional updates and information will be placed on our website and released through multiple information channels as soon as it is available.

Meal deliveries by bus will continue, and our latest schedules are posted on our website. You will also be able to pick up student meals at the following schools from 9 a.m. to 11 a.m., Monday through Friday:
Bells Elementary School (12088 Bells Highway, Ruffin SC)
Black Street Early Childhood Center (256 Smith Street, Walterboro SC)
Colleton County Middle School (1379 Tuskegee Airman Drive, Walterboro SC)
Cottageville Elementary School (648 Peirce Road, Cottageville SC)
Hendersonville Elementary School (6089 Hendersonville Highway, Walterboro SC)

Colleton County School District is happy to report that starting Monday, March 30, six buses with Wi-Fi capability will be placed at several of our schools to provide our community with Internet access during our closure period. These buses will be available at the following schools from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m., Monday through Friday:
Bells Elementary School (12088 Bells Highway, Ruffin SC)
Black Street Early Childhood Center (256 Smith Street, Walterboro SC)
Colleton County Middle School (1379 Tuskegee Airman Drive, Walterboro SC)
Cottageville Elementary School (648 Peirce Road, Cottageville SC)
Forest Hills Elementary School (633 Hiers Corner Road, Walterboro, SC)
Hendersonville Elementary School (6089 Hendersonville Highway, Walterboro SC)

div.span: Users must park their vehicles within 250 feet of the bus to use the Wi-Fi hotspot, and the internet connection provided is content-filtered to prevent access to unapproved websites. The password to access the Wi-Fi connection will be clearly placed on multiple sides of the bus for maximum visibility.

span.strong: Each of these sites will be regularly patrolled by school safety staff. School facilities and restrooms will not be available for visitor use, and all those using the bus Wi-Fi must remain in their cars to comply with the Centers for Disease Control social distancing guidelines.

div.span: All of us at CCSD are excited to be able to provide this service to our students and their families!

p.span: Colleton County School District will remain closed through April 30, in compliance with Governor Henry McMaster's latest closure order.

The CCSD is currently working to prepare additional distance learning packets for our students. We will inform our community on the schedule for pick-up of new distance learning packets and delivery of completed distance learning packets as soon as possible on our website, through our phone dialers, mass emails, and releases sent to local media.

Meal deliveries by bus will continue, and our latest schedules are posted on our website. You will also be able to pick up student meals at the following schools from 9 a.m. to 11 a.m., Monday through Friday:
Bells Elementary School (12088 Bells Highway, Ruffin SC)
Black Street Early Childhood Center (256 Smith Street, Walterboro SC)
Colleton County Middle School (1379 Tuskegee Airman Drive, Walterboro SC)
Cottageville Elementary School (648 Peirce Road, Cottageville SC)
Hendersonville Elementary School (6089 Hendersonville Highway, Walterboro SC)

p.span: Registration for Colleton County parents who seek to have their child attend public school kindergarten or pre-kindergarten next school year (2020-21) will begin on February 3, 2020 through April 10, 2020.

Interested parents with children who will be 5 years-old by September 1, 2020 should complete kindergarten enrollment packets at the school serving their neighborhood’s attendance zone. Attendance zone information can be found on the Colleton County School District’s website.

Parents with children who will be 4 years-old by September 1, 2020 should register for pre-kindergarten at their zoned schools during the school day. Because space is limited for pre-kindergarten, 4 year-olds will be assessed for possible enrollment. You will need to register in advance and each school will contact you for screening. Screening appointments will be given at each school upon registration.

Decisions on placement for pre-kindergarten will be made at each school after screenings are complete. Children are ranked in order of greatest need for participation based on the Child Early Reading and Development Education Program (CERDEP) guidelines. Placement is not based on a first come first served basis. All participants are expected to attend regularly and for the full instructional day.

For all student enrollments, parents should bring their child’s long form birth certificate, state certificate of immunizations (shot record) and two proofs of residency such as a utility bill showing a home address.
For more information about registering a child in Colleton County, call your zoned school or the Office of Curriculum and Instruction at 843-782-4526 or view this flyer.

p.span: On Tuesday, October 1, 2019, the South Carolina Department of Education released school report cards for elementary, middle, and high schools throughout the state. The Every Student Succeeds Act of 2015 overhauled the state’s school accountability system by using seven metrics to measure school performance: standardized test scores, improvement of student performance on standardized test scores from prior years, the progress of English Learners measured by a standardized test, and student responses on a survey. Previous accountability systems only measured student achievement to calculate the overall school rating.
Please visit the links below for additional information regarding School Report Cards for both South Carolina and Colleton County School District.

a.span: Colleton County School District Press Release
South Carolina Department of Education Press Release
A Parent Guide to State and Local Report Cards

td.p: On Thursday, November 29, 2018, the South Carolina Department of Education and Education Oversight Committee released school and district report cards as part of the state’s new accountability system. The 2018 report cards reflect school and district performance during the 2017-2018 school year and contain overall school ratings for the first time since 2014.
Please visit the links below for additional information regarding School Report Cards for both South Carolina and Colleton County School District.

p.a: Link to the SC Department of Education Press Release
Colleton County School District Press Release
A Parent Guide to State and Local Report Cards
Colleton County School District Report Card
